verses.verse: Can you draw out <WH4900> Leviathan <WH3882> with a fishhook, <WH8257> or press down his tongue <WH3956> with a cord? <WH2256>
Can you put <WH7760> a rope <WH100> into his nose, <WH639> or pierce <WH5344> his jaw <WH3895> through with a hook? <WH2336>
Will he make many <WH7235> petitions <WH8469> to you, <WH1696> or will he speak soft words to you? <WH7390>
Will he make <WH3772> a covenant <WH1285> with you, <WH3947> that you should take him for a servant <WH5650> forever? <WH5769>
Will you play <WH7832> with him as with a bird? <WH6833> Or will you bind <WH7194> him for your girls? <WH5291>
Will traders <WH2271> barter <WH3739> for him? <WH2673> Will they part him among the merchants? <WH3669>
Can you fill <WH4390> his skin <WH5785> with barbed irons, <WH7905> or his head <WH7218> with fish <WH1709> spears? <WH6767>
Lay <WH7760> your hand <WH3709> on him. <WH2142> Remember the battle, <WH4421> and do so no more. <WH3254>
Behold, <WH8431> the hope of him is in vain. <WH3576> Won't <WH2904> one be cast down even at the sight of him? <WH4758>
None is so fierce <WH393> that he dare stir him up. <WH5782> Who then is he who can stand <WH3320> before me? <WH6440>
Who has first given <WH6923> to me, <WH7999> that I should repay him? <WH8064> Everything under the heavens is mine.
"I will not keep silence concerning <WH2790> his limbs, <WH907> nor his mighty strength, <WH1369> nor his goodly <WH2433> frame. <WH6187>
Who can strip <WH1540> off his outer <WH6440> garment? <WH3830> Who shall come <WH935> within <WH3718> his jaws? <WH7448>
Who can open <WH6605> the doors <WH1817> of his face? <WH6440> Around <WH5439> his teeth <WH8127> is terror. <WH367>
Strong scales <WH4043> are his pride, <WH1346> shut up together <WH5462> with a close <WH6862> seal. <WH2368>
One <WH259> is so near <WH5066> to another, <WH259> that no air <WH7307> can come between them. <WH935>
They are joined <WH1692> one <WH376> to another. <WH251> They stick together, <WH3920> so that they can't <WH6504> be pulled apart.
His sneezing <WH5846> flashes <WH1984> out light. <WH216> His eyes <WH5869> are like the eyelids <WH6079> of the morning. <WH7837>
Out of his mouth <WH6310> go <WH1980> burning torches. <WH3940> Sparks <WH3590> of fire <WH784> leap forth. <WH4422>
Out of his nostrils <WH5156> a smoke <WH6227> goes, <WH3318> as of a boiling <WH5301> pot <WH1731> over a fire of reeds. <WH100>
His breath <WH5315> kindles <WH3857> coals. <WH1513> A flame <WH3851> goes forth <WH3318> from his mouth. <WH6310>
There is strength <WH5797> in <WH3885> his neck. <WH6677> Terror <WH1670> dances <WH1750> before him. <WH6440>
The flakes <WH4651> of his flesh <WH1320> are joined together. <WH1692> They are firm <WH3332> on him. <WH4131> They can't be moved.
His heart <WH3820> is as firm <WH3332> as a stone, <WH68> yes, <WH3332> firm as the lower <WH8482> millstone. <WH6400>
When he raises himself up, <WH7613> the mighty <WH352> are afraid. <WH1481> They retreat <WH7667> before his thrashing. <WH2398>
If one attacks <WH5381> him with the sword, <WH2719> it can't <WH6965> prevail; nor the spear, <WH2595> the dart, <WH4551> nor the pointed shaft. <WH8302>
He counts <WH2803> iron <WH1270> as straw; <WH8401> and brass <WH5154> as rotten <WH7539> wood. <WH6086>
The arrow <WH1121> can't <WH1272> make him flee. Sling <WH68> stones are like <WH2015> chaff to him. <WH7179>
Clubs <WH8455> are counted <WH2803> as stubble. <WH7179> He laughs <WH7832> at the rushing <WH7494> of the javelin. <WH3591>
His undersides are like sharp <WH2303> potsherds, <WH2789> leaving <WH7502> a trail in the mud <WH2916> like a threshing sledge. <WH2742>
He makes the deep <WH4688> to boil <WH7570> like a pot. <WH5518> He makes <WH7760> the sea <WH3220> like a pot of ointment. <WH4841>
He makes a path <WH5410> shine <WH215> after <WH310> him. <WH2803> One would think the deep had white hair. <WH8415>
On earth <WH6083> there is not his equal, <WH4915> that is made <WH6213> without <WH1097> fear. <WH2844>
He sees <WH7200> everything that is high. <WH1364> He is king <WH4428> over all the sons <WH1121> of pride. <WH7830>"
